subject: Critical Thinking
title: Modus Ponens: The King of Deduction
description: A short lesson to help you apply Modus Ponens: The King of Deduction.

hook.text: If it rains, the street gets wet. It's raining. Therefore the street is wet. Flawless logic ‚Äî every time.

buildup.text: This pattern is modus ponens: If P then Q. P is true. Therefore Q is true.

discovery.text: It's the most fundamental rule in all of logic ‚Äî you can build entire mathematical systems from it.

twist.text: Its evil twin, affirming the consequent, tricks millions: 'The street is wet, so it must have rained.' No!

climax.text: The difference between modus ponens and its twin is the #1 logic error in everyday arguments.

punchline.text: If P then Q. Q happened. That doesn't mean P did.

quiz.question: What error does 'affirming the consequent' commit?
options: Assuming Q proves P in 'if P then Q'
